sentences.english: I have made a miserable botch of this description.
sentences.chinese: 我这段描写简直搞得糟透了。

sentences.english: But the current state of Chinese humanities is frankly atrocious.
sentences.chinese: 但是，当下中国的人文教育状况实在是糟透了。

sentences.english: Maybe the application still runs, but the performance is terrible.
sentences.chinese: 又或者，应用程序还能运行，但性能糟透了。

sentences.english: Another 22 points. I hope she has lousy letters.
sentences.chinese: 又是22分，我希望她的字母糟透了。

sentences.english: Its very urgent. I felt awful.
sentences.chinese: 是很急的病，我觉得糟透了。

sentences.english: Also don't have confidence in learning, learning achievement is terrible.
sentences.chinese: 对学习也没信心了，学习成绩糟透了。

sentences.english: “There was no joy to life,” she said.
sentences.chinese: 生命没有乐趣，我从头到脚都糟透了。

sentences.english: Maybe I was at my exercise class.You look kawful.
sentences.chinese: 可能我在上健身课，你看起来糟透了。

sentences.english: He murdered the piece of music.
sentences.chinese: 他把那支曲子演得糟透了。

sentences.english: On bad days I would say this method is terrible.
sentences.chinese: 在不好的时候我会说这种办法糟透了。

sentences.english: We need to know what a real bill looks like.
sentences.chinese: 我今天感觉糟透了，你碰上我算你倒楣。

sentences.english: Everyone knows flying sucks these days.
sentences.chinese: 大家都知道近些天来航空公司的服务糟透了。

sentences.english: The smell in there is terrible.

definition: to lose all interest in life (idiom)
to have had enough of/to be fed up with/to have had one's fill of
to blow one's top/to be driven mad/to become frantic
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
muddled and completely collapsing (idiom); in an awful condition/complete shambles/a total mess
a day drags past like a year (idiom); time hangs heavy/time crawls when one is wretched
